results.title: The Jazz Butcher Reissues Start Here

results.headline: In Memory of Pat Fish
results.summary: In the Spring of 2016, I sent my musical hero, Pat Fish, a list of questions. From the obvious like how the band name came to be born, to what was on Pat's reading list, to more complex items in one's life. Where do his inspiration come from and what made Pat dive into sadness.

results.headline: COVERS ONE OF THE BEST PERIODS IN BRITISH POP
results.subhead: The career retrospective of the veritable Pat Fish, aka the Jazz Butcher, continues with four (more) albums of crazy/beautiful indie pop. Not your typical Creation Records fare.

results.title: Owen Jones
results.summary: Excerpted from the musician-to-musician podcasts by Mike Watt (of The Minutemen) speaking with Owen Jones (via Skype). Mostly "Shakespeare and The Bible", and some passing Jazz Butcher commentary.

results.title: Steve Wilson talks to PAT FISH
Episode #206
results.headline: EARLY DAYS TO JAZZ BUTCHER'S FIRST RELEASE 'IN BATH OF BACON'
results.summary: Why did he decide to choose music over an academic route way? Where did the group name 'Jazz Butcher' come from? What negative event was the inspiration behind the classic song 'Next Move Sideways'? Why did Mark E Smith write to Pat? What were the circumstances that lead Brix Smith to thump Jazz Butcher drummer Owen Jones? How did he get involved in The Dan Treacey Benefit? And many, many more great anecdotes......

results.title: Pat Fish
results.headline: The former Creation Records artist died earlier this week

results.title: Pat Fish (The Jazz Butcher)
results.summary:
An interview and obit, combined.
			"He loved his cat, he loved to read, he loved to drink, he loved to smoke and he loved to play music. Recorded in 2013 as the Jazz Butcher’s The Last Of The Gentleman Adventurers album hit shelves, this interview finds Fish in fine form, talking about the new record, Roddy Frame, The Blue Nile, his long-standing relationship with Eider and why it’s so hard to age in rock and roll…"
